She met a young Iraqi girl who's living on the edge of adulthood and also on the edge of prostitution.
She's absolutely tiny.
Skinny arms and legs with a headscarf that keeps slipping off her thick black hair.
She swears she's a good girl and doesn't go around with bad people, but the faint shimmer of makeup on her cheeks and the chipped nail polish on her little fingers tell a different story.
(Through translator) They'll say, look, she's so beautiful, or hi and give me candy.

But I walk away without saying a word.
Rhagad is 13.
She has the smart-aleck swagger common in many street kids, and she's defensive when she talks.

Hearing her talk, Rhagad starts to cry.
(Through translator) Do you think I have relations with boys?
